sources.data_found: Department context: Confirms degree programs (BS, MS, PhD) in Computer Science under the College of Engineering and Physical Sciences (CEPS).

student_data.notes: Counts derived from UNH Institutional Research 'Enrollment by Major' data for Fall 2023. Undergrad count includes Computer Science (BS) majors in the College of Engineering and Physical Sciences (CEPS). Grad count represents Computer Science MS students. PhD count represents Computer Science PhD students. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Older documentation references 4 nodes with 2x K80 GPUs, though these may be decommissioned; included for completeness based on wiki history.

gpu_resources.notes:
Calculations based on Premise Cluster Hardware Wiki (publicly viewable):
- A100 Nodes: 2 nodes × 4 GPUs/node = 8 A100s (VRAM unspecified, assumed 40GB standard for this cluster generation).
- V100 Nodes: 4 nodes × 4 GPUs/node = 16 V100s.
- P100 Nodes: 18 nodes × 2 GPUs/node = 36 P100s. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

compute_credits.description: UNH RCC generally offers a standard allocation to UNH researchers at no direct cost; priority queues or buy-in options exist but explicit 'compute credit' dollar values for students were not found.

analysis_notes: UNH resources are centralized in the 'Premise' cluster. Student counts are solid based on 2023 Institutional Research data. GPU counts are exact based on the technical wiki hardware listing.
